title: Indentation contains mixed spaces and tabs
description: Use either spaces or tabs for indentation, but not both. PEP 8 recommends using 4 spaces per indentation level.

title: Indentation is not a multiple of four
description: Indentation should be exactly 4 spaces per level. Consistent indentation improves code readability.

title: Missing whitespace around operator
description: Binary operators should be surrounded by a single space on either side. This improves readability and follows Python conventions.

title: Missing whitespace after comma
description: Add a space after commas in function calls, lists, and other constructs to improve readability.

title: Line too long
description: Limit all lines to a maximum of 79 characters for code, or 72 for comments and docstrings. Long lines reduce readability.

title: Trailing whitespace
description: Remove trailing whitespace at the end of lines. Trailing whitespace can cause issues with version control and is unnecessary.

title: Class name should use CapWords convention
description: Class names should use the CapWords (PascalCase) convention. This distinguishes classes from functions and variables.

title: Function name should be lowercase
description: Function names should be lowercase with words separated by underscores (snake_case). This follows Python naming conventions.

title: Variable in function should be lowercase
description: Variable names should be lowercase with words separated by underscores. This maintains consistency with function naming.

title: Function is too complex
description: Functions with high cyclomatic complexity (>10) are difficult to understand, test, and maintain. Consider breaking into smaller functions.

title: Function has too many parameters
description: Functions with more than 5 parameters are difficult to use and understand. Consider using a configuration object or breaking the function apart.

title: Missing docstring
description: All public functions, classes, and modules should have docstrings explaining their purpose, parameters, and return values.

title: Docstring should be in Google style
description: Use Google-style docstrings for consistency. Include Args, Returns, and Raises sections as appropriate.

title: Unused import
description: Remove unused imports to keep the code clean and reduce memory usage. Unused imports can confuse developers about dependencies.

title: Import should be at top of file
description: All imports should be at the top of the file, after module docstrings and before module globals and constants.

title: Avoid wildcard imports
description: Avoid using 'from module import *' as it pollutes the namespace and makes it unclear where names come from.

title: Hardcoded password or secret
description: Avoid hardcoding passwords, API keys, or other secrets in source code. Use environment variables or secure configuration files.

title: Use of eval() function
description: The eval() function can execute arbitrary code and is a security risk. Consider safer alternatives like ast.literal_eval().

title: Inefficient string concatenation
description: Using '+' for multiple string concatenations is inefficient. Use join() or f-strings for better performance.

title: Use list comprehension instead of loop
description: List comprehensions are more Pythonic and often faster than equivalent for loops for creating lists.

title: Missing type hints
description: Add type hints to function parameters and return values to improve code documentation and enable static type checking.

examples.good: def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:

title: Use Union for multiple types
description: When a parameter can accept multiple types, use Union[Type1, Type2] for clarity.

examples.good:
from typing import Union
def process(value: Union[str, int]) -> str:

title: Missing unit tests
description: All public functions should have corresponding unit tests to ensure correctness and prevent regressions.

title: Test function naming convention
description: Test functions should start with 'test_' and have descriptive names indicating what they test.

title: Bare except clause
description: Avoid bare 'except:' clauses. Catch specific exceptions to avoid hiding bugs and make error handling more precise.

title: Empty except block
description: Empty except blocks hide errors silently. At minimum, log the exception or add a comment explaining why it's ignored.
